rubric.name: Full-Stack Web Application Assessment
rubric.description: Comprehensive evaluation rubric for full-stack web development projects

criteria.title: API Endpoints Implementation
criteria.gptInstructions: Evaluate the RESTful API design, endpoint structure, HTTP methods usage, request/response handling, and overall API architecture quality.

levels.excellent: All endpoints properly implemented with correct HTTP methods, comprehensive error handling, and excellent RESTful design
levels.good: Most endpoints working correctly with proper HTTP methods and adequate error handling
levels.fair: Basic endpoints functional but with some HTTP method issues or limited error handling
levels.poor: Endpoints missing, incorrect HTTP methods, or lacking error handling

criteria.title: Database Schema & Migrations
criteria.gptInstructions: Assess database schema design, table relationships, data types, constraints, indexes, and migration files. Look for normalization, referential integrity, and proper use of database features.

levels.excellent: Well-normalized schema with proper relationships, constraints, indexes, and comprehensive migrations
levels.good: Functional schema with appropriate relationships and basic constraints
levels.fair: Basic schema structure but missing some relationships or constraints
levels.poor: Poor schema design with missing relationships or incorrect data types

criteria.title: Unit & Integration Tests
criteria.gptInstructions: N/A - Evaluated purely through automated test execution

levels.excellent: Comprehensive test coverage (>80%) with unit and integration tests passing
levels.good: Good test coverage (60-80%) with most tests passing
levels.fair: Basic test coverage (40-60%) with some tests passing
levels.poor: Minimal or no test coverage, or most tests failing

criteria.title: Authentication & Authorization
criteria.gptInstructions: Evaluate authentication implementation (JWT, sessions, etc.), password security (hashing), authorization logic (role-based access control), and protection of sensitive routes.

levels.excellent: Secure authentication with proper password hashing, JWT implementation, and comprehensive RBAC
levels.good: Functional authentication with basic security measures and role-based access
levels.fair: Basic authentication implemented but with some security concerns

criteria.title: Code Quality & TypeScript Usage
criteria.gptInstructions: Assess TypeScript usage, type safety, code organization, naming conventions, code reusability, separation of concerns, and overall code cleanliness. Look for proper use of interfaces, types, generics, and TypeScript best practices.

levels.excellent: Excellent TypeScript usage with proper types, interfaces, clean code structure, and best practices
levels.good: Good type usage with organized code and reasonable practices
levels.fair: Basic TypeScript usage but with some 'any' types or organizational issues
levels.poor: Poor type usage, disorganized code, or extensive use of 'any'
